description: The fastest way to build data apps in Python.

dependencies.name: pil
dependencies.description:
Pillow-SIMD is a SIMD-enabled fork of Pillow. It is usually 4-6x faster
than the original Pillow in image processing benchmarks.

dependencies.name: py-altair
dependencies.description: Declarative statistical visualization library for Python

dependencies.name: py-blinker
dependencies.description: Fast, simple object-to-object and broadcast signaling

dependencies.name: py-cachetools
dependencies.description:
This module provides various memoizing collections and decorators,
including variants of the Python 3 Standard Library @lru_cache function
decorator.

dependencies.name: py-click
dependencies.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit.

dependencies.name: py-importlib-metadata
dependencies.description: Read metadata from Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-protobuf
dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.

dependencies.name: py-pyarrow
dependencies.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the Python bindings.

dependencies.name: py-pympler
dependencies.description:
Development tool to measure, monitor and analyze the memory behavior of
Python objects in a running Python application.

dependencies.name: py-python-dateutil
dependencies.description: Extensions to the standard Python datetime module.

dependencies.name: py-requests
dependencies.description: Python HTTP for Humans.

dependencies.name: py-rich
dependencies.description:
Rich is a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the
terminal.

dependencies.name: py-semver
dependencies.description: A Python module for semantic versioning. Simplifies comparing versions.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-toml
dependencies.description:
A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-tzlocal
dependencies.description: tzinfo object for the local timezone.

dependencies.name: py-validators
dependencies.description: Python Data Validation for Humans.

dependencies.name: py-watchdog
dependencies.description: Python library and shell utilities to monitor filesystem events.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
